isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING LIGHT SYSTEMS - OPERATION - PARK/TURN/SIDE MARKER LIGHTS 9300 W/DRL

svcproc.title: PARK/TURN/SIDE MARKER LIGHTS 9300 W/DRL
svcproc.para: When the headlight switch is in the park or position, and the cab and trailer lights switch is ON, the cab and trailer lights relay is energized and power flows on circuits 68E and 68D through fuse F8-C to circuits 68C and 58H. Then the current is split through circuit 58T to the left park/turn/marker light low element and circuit 58U to the right park/turn/marker light low element. The ground circuits for the left light are 56-G and 52-GA to J7 cab ground. The ground circuits for the right marker are 57-G and 52-GD to J7 cab ground.
The turn signal switch provides power on circuit 56D to the left side turn light and circuit 56 to the left/park/turn/marker light high element.
The turn signal switch provides power on circuit 57D to the right side turn light and circuit 57 to the right/park/turn/marker light high element.

The ground path for the park/turn/marker lights was mentioned above. The ground path for the left side turn light is circuit 56-GA and 11-GD to ground stud at left dash panel. The ground path for the right side turn light is circuit 57-GA, and 11-GB to ground stud at right dash panel.
